result.execSummary:
The defendant Julie A. Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Transfer (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. - stayed
Concurrent with: with present probation serving

miscConds.notes:
Follow all conditions of current probation cases she is serving.
No contact with Walmart except for apology letter that must be given to Agent first.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julie A. Campbell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

2:33 p.m. Defendant Julie A. Campbell in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 10 days jail. Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
State informs that Victim Notification has been complied with.
ADA Constable makes sentencing statements.
Atty Halverson makes sentencing statements requests no jail and some community service. If jail, then requests home monitoring and Defendant wants to write an apology letter to Walmart and give it to her probation officer.

BY THE COURT:**********PROBATION********
I/S sentence:   30 days jail w/huber for work - stayed
1 yr   Probation, concurrent with present probation
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
Follow all conditions of current probation cases she is serving.
No contact with Walmart except for apology letter that must be given to Agent first.
No contact with Walmart in Plover, WI.

Defendant Julie A. Campbell in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

Atty Cousins recommends a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
